metadata.dc:author: Gasca-García, A
Rivera-Dommarco, J
Barquera, S
metadata.dc:description: Mexico has a long-standing history of programs and policies oriented to improve the nutrition of vulnerable groups. However, malnutrition represents one of the main public health challenges in Mexico. This article provides a historic perspective of the main strategies, programs and policies that have been carried out in Mexico, as well as a detailed analysis of their design, implementation, and selected results. Finally, some critical issues related to food policies implemented in Mexico are identified.
metadata.dc:title: Políticas y programas de alimentación y nutrición en México.
[Policies and programs of food and nutrition in Mexico].
